title: Responsive Design With Bootstrap
author: Dylan Miles
description: Responsive design is an important aspect of creating websites that can adapt and function well across a wide range of devices, including desktops, laptops, tablets, and smartphones. The main objective of responsive design is to ensure that users can easily access and navigate a website regardless of the device they use. Bootstrap is a very popular front-end framework that has gained recognition for its versatility and user-friendliness. It is an open-source tool that provides developers with a broad range of pre-designed templates and components like forms, buttons, navigation menus, and typography. Bootstraps built-in support for responsive design makes it an excellent choice for developers looking to create websites that are both visually appealing and functional on any device. Bootstraps responsive design features are enabled by a flexible and customizable grid system that allows developers to create layouts that can adapt to various screen sizes. The framework provides an intuitive set of classes that allow developers to define the size and position of website elements based on screen size, such as hiding or displaying elements, resizing columns, and adjusting font sizes. In addition to its grid system, Bootstrap also includes other features that make it easy to create responsive websites, such as support for responsive images and a wide range of breakpoints for different screen sizes. By using Bootstraps responsive design features, developers can save time and ensure consistency across different devices, providing a seamless user experience. In conclusion, responsive design is a very important aspect of modern web development, and Bootstraps built-in support for responsive design makes it a great choice for developers looking to create websites that are both visually appealing and functional on all devices.

title: HTML - An Introduction
author: Rob Larsen
description: HTML, or Hypertext Markup Language, is a computer language used for creating web pages. HTML is the backbone of the web, providing the structure and content of every website you visit. In simpler terms, HTML is like the blueprint of a building. Just as a blueprint provides instructions for building a physical structure, HTML provides instructions for building a web page. It tells web browsers how to display content, like text, images, and videos, on a webpage and how to organize that content into headings, paragraphs, lists, and other elements. You can write HTML code in plain text editors, like NotePad. HTML code is made up of tags, which are enclosed in brackets. These tags tell the browser how to display the content between them. HTML also allows you to include links to other pages, images, videos, and audio files. Another important aspect of HTML is the use of Cascading Style Sheets (CSS). CSS is used to control the visual appearance of a webpage, such as font styles, colors, and layout. CSS is written in a separate file, but can be linked to the HTML file using the <link> tag. HTML also supports the use of scripts (JavaScript/TypeScript), which are used to add interactive features to web pages, such as drop-down menus, sliders, and animations. The scripts are included in the HTML file with the <script> tag.

title: JavaScript - An Introduction
author: David Flanagan
description: JavaScript is a programming language used for creating interactive and dynamic web pages. It allows you to add functionality and interactivity to your website, making it more engaging and user-friendly. JavaScript is a client-side language, meaning that it is executed by the web browser on the user's device. This allows for faster and more responsive web pages, as the browser can execute JavaScript code without having to wait for server responses. One of the great features of JavaScript is its ability to manipulate the Document Object Model (DOM) of a web page. JavaScript can be used to manipulate the DOM structure and create dynamic effects like animations, pop-ups, and form validation. JavaScript can also be used for handling user input and creating interactive elements like buttons, drop-down menus, and sliders. By listening for user events like clicks and keypresses, JavaScript can perform actions like showing and hiding elements, updating text and images, and submitting form data. Another important feature of JavaScript is its ability to retrieve and send data to a server using AJAX (Asynchronous JavaScript and XML) requests. This allows for dynamic loading of content without having to refresh the entire web page, resulting in a faster and smoother user experience. JavaScript is a versatile language that can be used for a variety of tasks beyond web development. It can be used for server-side programming with Node.js, building desktop and mobile applications with frameworks like React Native, and even creating games and visualizations with external, open-source libraries. JavaScript is an essential language for creating modern, interactive, and dynamic web pages. With its ability to manipulate the DOM, handle user input, and make AJAX requests, JavaScript provides developers with the tools they need to create engaging websites. As a beginner, learning JavaScript can be a challenging but rewarding experience that opens up a world of possibilities in web development.

title: CSS - An Introduction
author: Jamie Chan
description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a language used for styling HTML pages. HTML only provides the structure and content of a web page, and CSS is used to define its appearance, layout, and design. CSS allows you to customize the colors, fonts, backgrounds, and positioning of elements on the web page. It gives you the ability to create appealing and user-friendly websites. Using css is easy and only requires the creation of a separate css file to accompany your already existing HTML file. You can also include CSS code directly within your HTML file using the <style> tag. CSS works by using selectors to target specific HTML elements and applying styles to them. You can use regular HTML selectors change their attributes. In addition to basic selectors, CSS also allows you to use advanced selectors such as attribute selectors, class selectors, and ID selectors. These selectors give you more precise control over the elements you want to style. CSS also provides a variety of layout and positioning options, such as the display and position properties. These properties allow you to create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and devices. One of the benefits of using CSS is that it allows you to separate the presentation and content of a web page. This means that you can change the appearance of a web page without changing its structure or content. This makes it easier to maintain and update your website over time. CSS is a powerful tool for styling and designing web pages. By using CSS, you can create beautiful websites that reflect anything you want. With its flexible selectors, layout options, and separation of presentation and content, CSS is an essential part of modern web development.
